--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Greg Barton" <greg_barton@y...> wrote:

> 
> By suboptimal do you mean computationally less efficient?  If so, 
then
> no.  It's not that they are built suboptimally, it's that I'd like 
to
> find a way to evolve them automatically to change their logical
> function. (i.e. change what they compute instead of how they 
compute.)
>  I suppose you could try to evolve more efficient networks, but 
that's
> already a pretty straightforward process.
> 

Greg, can you give an example of some logical function or an 
application area you'd like to evolve a RETE network for?

ken
